articles.title: Frequently used (by me) git commands
articles.description: Incomplete list of frequently used GitHub commands
articles.contents:
Branches
Make new branch
git checkout -b branchName
Switch branches
git checkout branchName
Clean up branches
Delete local branches git branch -d <branch>
In the RStudio list (remote branches I deleted still show)
git fetch -p then click the drop down arrow on the refresh circle and click Refresh Now`

Change default branch name from master to main:https://stevenmortimer.com/5-steps-to-change-github-default-branch-from-master-to-main/
I need to switch from HTTPS to SSH or vice versa (again…)
What’s my remote URL?
git remote -v
Changing the remote repository url
git remote set-url origin <paste url> Note that origin is the nickname you give the remote

articles.title: Git workflows with RStudio
articles.description: A short introduction to using Git / GitHub with RStudio and RStudio Connect
articles.contents:
For getting started with Git and GitHub in RStudio, I recommend:
Git workflows:
Happy Git and GitHub for the useR: https://happygitwithr.com/

Git / Github best practices and use of Git in the RStudio IDE:
This section of R Packages, by Wickham: http://r-pkgs.had.co.nz/git.html

Dive deeper into the fundamentals of git:
Version Control, from The Missing Semester of Your CS Education: https://missing.csail.mit.edu/2020/version-control/
Pro Git book (online): https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2




fitvids('.shareagain', {players: 'iframe'});
